user_question: What would happen to global sea levels if all the ice in Antarctica melted?
final_answer: If all the ice in Antarctica melted, global sea levels would rise by approximately 58 meters (190 feet), which would have catastrophic impacts on coastal cities and ecosystems worldwide.
